title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.001
frontText: Given an outer class Opossum and its inner class Tail, how would you create an instance of Tail within a static method of Opossum?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.002
frontText: Name the five method types available in an interface.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.003
frontText: True or false? An inner class can include some static members.
backText: True. An inner class can contain static final fields.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.004
frontText: True or false? A private static interface method can access a default interface method within the same interface.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.005
frontText: True or false? A local class can only be declared as extending one class or implementing one interface.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.006
frontText: Which nested class types can be marked abstract or final?
backText: Inner classes, static nested classes, and local classes

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.007
frontText: What modifiers are permitted on variables in the parameter list of a lambda expression?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.008
frontText: What is the shortest equivalent form of the following lambda expression? (Animal a) -> { return 5; }

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.009
frontText: What is the result of extending a class marked final?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.010
frontText: Given an enum Seasons, with values Seasons.FALL, Seasons.WINTER, Seasons.SPRING, and Seasons.SUMMER and a switch statement that uses this enum, what format should the case values be in?
backText: They should be written without the enum name, such as case FALL, not case Seasons.FALL, which does not compile.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.011
frontText: What access modifiers are permitted for enum constructors?
backText: They are implicitly private, which means the compiler treats them as private whether a modifier is declared or not.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.012
frontText: How do you mark an annotation element as optional?
backText: Provide a non‐null constant value with the default modifier.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.013
frontText: What modifiers are implicitly applied to all annotation elements?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.014
frontText: How do you define an annotation value that can be provided without an element name?
backText: Name the element value() and make sure there are no other elements that have required values.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.015
frontText: What annotation is used to specify what declarations other annotations can be applied to? What type of values does it take?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.016
frontText: What are the three possible values for the @Retention annotation?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.017
frontText: What annotation is used to document the reason why a method is deprecated?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.018
frontText: What are the requirements to apply the @SafeVarargs annotation to a declaration?
backText: It can be applied only to a method containing a varargs parameter and not capable of being overridden (it must be marked private, static, or final).

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.019
frontText: How many annotations are required to create a repeatable annotation?
backText: Two—the repeatable annotation and its associated containing type annotation

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.020
frontText: True or false? Adding an @Override annotation to an existing method may cause a compiler error.
backText: True. If the method is not a valid override, the compiler will report an error.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.021
frontText: What value should you pass to @SuppressWarnings to ignore using a List without a generic type?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.022
frontText: Name two reasons a developer would apply the @FunctionalInterface annotation to an interface.
backText: A developer might want to document that an interface is a functional interface. Also, the developer might want to trigger a compiler error if someone mistakenly alters the interface to no longer contain a single abstract method.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.023
frontText: Annotation elements must be of what type?
backText: A primitive type, a String, a Class, an enum, another annotation, or an array of any of these types

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.024
frontText: Write code to declare an ArrayList of Integer objects using the diamond operator and store it in a List.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.025
frontText: Assuming T is a generic type, fill in the blank to make this code compile so that the method returns the same type it is passed in: public static _________ returnObject(T o) { return o;}

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.026
frontText: What does FIFO stand for, and what Java Collections Framework interface is it associated with?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.027
frontText: Does this compile? List listOfLists = new ArrayList();
backText: No. A lower/upper bound may be specified on the left side of a declaration but not the right side.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.028
frontText: Fill in the blank to make this code compile: List<______ Number> listOfNumbers = new ArrayList

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.029
frontText: What method do you need to implement in a Comparable, and how many parameters does it take?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.030
frontText: Does this code compile? List listOfNumbers = new ArrayList();
backText: Yes. For upper and lower bounds, the extends and super keywords include the class itself.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.031
frontText: Rewrite this code using a method reference given that a List is passed in: x -> x.isEmpty()

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.032
frontText: What Java Collections Framework interface uses numeric indexes?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.033
frontText: True or false? We can add an element to a List.
backText: False. List

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.034
frontText: What three methods taking a lambda as a parameter can you call directly on an ArrayList (without using a stream)?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.035
frontText: Which functional interface takes one parameter and returns a (possibly) different Object type?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.036
frontText: Which of these have a return type of Stream: source, intermediate operation, terminal operation?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.037
frontText: Which Collector creates a single String from a Stream?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.038
frontText: Name a terminal operation that returns an Optional.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.039
frontText: Which functional interface takes two parameters and has an accept() method?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.040
frontText: Which Collector returns both the average and the sum in a single call to an IntStream?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.041
frontText: Which functional interface takes one parameter and returns the same Object type?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.042
frontText: What are the names of all of the primitive streams?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.043
frontText: How do you create an Optional with the value "hi"?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.044
frontText: What method do you call on an IntStream instance to convert it to a Stream?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.045
frontText: What are the primitive optional types?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.046
frontText: Which of these are required in a stream pipeline: source, intermediate operation, terminal operation?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.047
frontText: What is the difference between a checked and unchecked exception?
backText: A checked exception must be handled or declared in the method in which it is thrown, while an unchecked exception does not.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.048
frontText: Which constructors must be implemented in every custom exception class?
backText: When creating a custom exception, implementing a constructor is not required.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.049
frontText: True or false? A class must implement Closeable to be used in a try‐with‐resources statement.
backText: False. The class must implement AutoCloseable. While Closeable is supported in try‐with‐resources statements (since Closeable extends AutoCloseable), it’s possible to have a class that implements AutoCloseable but not Closeable.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.050
frontText: How are suppressed exceptions created?
backText: When more than one exception is thrown at the same time, all but the first exception are suppressed. Suppressed exceptions can come from close() methods within try‐with‐resource statements or a finally block.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.051
frontText: What is the syntax of an assertion statement?
backText: It must use the assert keyword, followed by a required boolean condition. An optional colon (:) followed by a message can also be added.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.052
frontText: Which java.time class would be best to use to share your birthdate?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.053
frontText: What character is used to escape values in a date formatter?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.054
frontText: Define the proper format for a locale String and provide an example of one.
backText: A locale is defined with a required lowercase language code and optional uppercase country code. They are separated by an underscore (_) if both are provided. An example is en_GB for English/Great Britain.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.055
frontText: What is a locale category, and how is it used?
backText: A locale category is a way to differentiate between the display and formatting of locale‐based values.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.056
frontText: True or false? If a resource bundle for the requested locale is not available, the default locale may be used.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.057
frontText: When working with a number formatter, which symbol omits the digit if not does exist?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.058
frontText: What type of module has a module-info file?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.059
frontText: In a service, what class do you call to obtain a list of service providers?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.060
frontText: What type of module is on the module path but does not have a module-info.java file?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.061
frontText: Which module is available to all other modules by default?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.062
frontText: What option do you pass to jdeps to restrict output to a list of modules?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.063
frontText: When do you need to specify the provides directive?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.064
frontText: What term defines two modules that mutually attempt to depend on each other?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.065
frontText: In a top‐down migration of three modules, how many modules are on the module path after migrating the first module?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.066
frontText: How do you call a ServiceLoader to get all services that implement the service provider interface Magic?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.067
frontText: In a top‐down migration, what two module types are involved?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.068
frontText: True or false? If an automatic module name is not specified, Java keeps dashes in the generated name.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.069
frontText: What elements comprise a service?
backText: Service provider interface and service locator

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.070
frontText: What method is used to retrieve a parallel stream from an existing stream?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.071
frontText: True or false? The CyclicBarrier may trigger its barrier more than once.
backText: True. Once the barrier has been reached, it may be used again.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.072
frontText: What is it called when two threads are stuck forever but appear to be active and making progress?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.073
frontText: What method in Thread is used to spawn an asynchronous task?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.074
frontText: What ScheduledExecutorService method allows a task to be completed at the same time every hour?
backText: scheduleAtFixedRate(Runnable command, long initialDelay, long period, TimeUnit unit)

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.075
frontText: True or false? The execute() method is used to submit a Callable task to an ExecutorService.
backText: False. The execute() method is for Runnable expressions only.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.076
frontText: Which ExecutorService method will synchronously wait for an entire Collection of tasks to complete?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.077
frontText: Which Lock method returns immediately if the lock cannot be acquired?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.078
frontText: True or false? An instance method that uses the synchronized modifier is equivalent to a method that does not, but instead wraps the body of the method in a synchronized(this) {} block.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.079
frontText: Which List class creates a new underlying instance of the class anytime it is modified?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.080
frontText: What is a stateful lambda expression?
backText: A stateful lambda expression is a lambda expression whose results depend on any state that might change during the execution of a pipeline.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.081
frontText: Which I/O stream class is best suited for reading a text file?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.082
frontText: Which java.io.File method is used to create a single directory?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.083
frontText: True or false? The absolute path /zoo/data.txt may refer to a file or directory.
backText: True. Directories can have extensions in their names.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.084
frontText: Name the four abstract base I/O stream classes.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.085
frontText: What is the advantage of using a Buffered I/O class?
backText: It often improves performance, especially when reading/writing large amounts of data.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.086
frontText: Which method should be called before calling mark() on an arbitrary InputStream?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.087
frontText: Name the methods in ObjectInputStream and ObjectOutputStream used to work with Object values.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.088
frontText: What exception is thrown if print() is called on a closed PrintStream?
backText: Trick question! PrintStream does not throw an exception. Use checkError() to check for an error.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.089
frontText: When reading byte values from an InputStream, what is the proper way to detect the end of the stream?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.090
frontText: What is the return type of the java.io.Console readPassword() method?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.091
frontText: When calling PrintWriter format() method, what is the meaning of the symbols %n and %d?
backText: The %n symbol is used to indicate a new line, while the %d symbol is used for integer values.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.092
frontText: Which modifier is used to indicate a field should not be serialized?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.093
frontText: True or false? The NIO.2 Files class includes an overloaded copy() method that can write a file to an I/O stream.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.094
frontText: Which NIO.2 method is used to make a directory, including all paths leading up to the directory?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.095
frontText: What is the default depth limit of Files.walk()?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.096
frontText: True or false? Files.walk() performs a breadth‐first search.
backText: False. It performs a depth‐first search.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.097
frontText: What is an advantage of using Files.find() over Files.walk()?
backText: Files.find() can filter elements with a BiPredicate expression.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.098
frontText: If you have a large file, which NIO.2 method should you use to read the lines of the file and why?
backText: Files.lines() since the data is read using lazy evaluation

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.099
frontText: When moving a file within the file system, what is an atomic move?
backText: An atomic move is one in which any process monitoring the file never sees an incomplete file.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.100
frontText: Which NIO.2 method is used to rename a directory?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.101
frontText: What is the name of the method that creates Path objects in the Path interface?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.102
frontText: What does the Path resolve() method do?
backText: It joins two paths. If the input argument to the method is an absolute path, then that value is returned.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.103
frontText: What is the result of calling Paths.get("../music/./note.txt").normalize()?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.104
frontText: What are the five key JDBC interfaces you need to know for the exam?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.105
frontText: Where is the implementation of ResultSet defined?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.106
frontText: What method gets the first column in a ResultSet if it is an int?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.107
frontText: What character is used to separate the three main parts of a JDBC URL?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.108
frontText: True or false? In a JDBC URL, the port is required.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.109
frontText: On what class do you call a method to create a CallableStatement?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.110
frontText: When closing a Statement, what other resources get closed?
backText: ResultSet, if there is one open by the statement

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.111
frontText: What methods on PreparedStatement can run a DELETE SQL statement?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.112
frontText: What parameter type can fill in the blank for a PreparedStatement in the following code? ps.setInt(_____, 1);

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.113
frontText: What does executeUpdate() return?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.114
frontText: What method should you call for OUT parameters when working with a CallableStatement?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.115
frontText: Using the most restrictive access modifier possible is an example of the principle of _______________.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.116
frontText: What type of copy does the clone() method make by default?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.117
frontText: __________ is an attack to trick a database query into doing something unexpected.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.118
frontText: What static field do you use to list all the fields you want serialized?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.119
frontText: Validating a string matches a list of characters is a ______________.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.120
frontText: True or false? You must be careful not to print confidential information to System.out, but it is OK to print it to System.err.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.121
frontText: An attack that disrupts legitimate requests is a _______________.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.122
frontText: What method often contains references to ObjectOutputStream.PutField?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.123
frontText: What type of object can’t change state?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.124
frontText: What kind of file does Java use to specify permissions?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.125
frontText: What modifiers do you need to use with serialPersistentFields?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f1.126
frontText: ___________________ is an attack that can run an unintended operating system command at the command line.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.001
frontText: Name the four types of nested classes.
backText: Inner class, static nested class, local class, and anonymous class

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.002
frontText: Given an interface Fly with no abstract methods, how would you create an instance of an anonymous class that implements it?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.003
frontText: Given an interface Cat with a default method meow(), what is the syntax for accessing this default method within a class that implements Cat, assuming that class may override the method?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.004
frontText: What condition determines whether an interface is a functional interface?
backText: It contains or inherits exactly one abstract method. The abstract method can also not have a matching signature as a public method in java.lang.Object.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.005
frontText: When is a return statement required in a lambda expression?
backText: When the body of the lambda expression is a code block {} and the functional interface associated with the lambda expression has a return type that is not void

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.006
frontText: What is the reason for applying the final modifier to a class?
backText: It prevents the class from being extended by another developer.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.007
frontText: True or false? An enum list requires a semicolon (;) after the list of values.
backText: False. It is optional if the enum contains only a list of values, and it is required if it contains anything besides the list of values.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.008
frontText: True or false? Enums must be written in all uppercase.
backText: False. This is a common style, but not required.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.009
frontText: True or false? A default interface method can access a private interface method within the same interface.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.010
frontText: True or false? An anonymous class can be declared only as extending one class or implementing one interface.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.011
frontText: Which nested class types can include static methods?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.012
frontText: Given an outer class Rooster and its inner class Wattle, how would you create an instance of Wattle within an instance method of Rooster?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.013
frontText: Which annotation is used to indicate a method should no longer be used and may be removed in future versions?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.014
frontText: Which annotation causes a class to generate Javadoc with its annotation type information?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.015
frontText: How do you mark an annotation element as required?
backText: Any element without a default value is considered required.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.016
frontText: What implicit modifiers are applied to all annotation variables?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.017
frontText: Which ElementType passed with @Target allows an annotation to be applied to a cast operation and object creation with new?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.018
frontText: What is the primary purpose of using an annotation?
backText: It provides metadata about often unrelated types.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.019
frontText: True or false? Annotations are inherited by default from super types.
backText: False. They require the @Inherited annotation to be inherited.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.020
frontText: What requirements allow you to pass an array to an annotation without using any braces ({})?
backText: The annotation must take an array value, and there must be only one element in the array.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.021
frontText: True or false? An annotation cannot be used more than once on the same declaration unless the annotation is declared with the @Repeatable annotation.
backText: True. By default, annotations are not repeatable.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.022
frontText: What value should you pass to @SuppressWarnings to ignore using a deprecated class?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.023
frontText: True or false? Removing a @FunctionalInterface annotation from an existing interface where it is used may cause a compiler error.
backText: False. While the behavior of the application could change, removing the annotation will not influence the compiler.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.024
frontText: What method do you need to implement in a Comparator, and how many parameters does it take?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.025
frontText: Fill in the blank to make this code compile: List<______ Number> listOfNumbers = new ArrayList();

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.026
frontText: What Java Collections Framework interface requires unique elements?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.027
frontText: Do lower or upper bounds allow you to add elements to a list?
backText: Lower bounds do because they specify the class that all types must be above using super.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.028
frontText: What Java Collections Framework interface has key/value pairs?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.029
frontText: Does this compile? List<> l = new ArrayList();
backText: No. The diamond operator must be on the right side.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.030
frontText: What are two ways of creating an immutable set?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.031
frontText: How can you create a Comparator that sorts User objects by getFirstName() as the primary sort order, and getLastName() as the secondary sort order?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.032
frontText: Rewrite this code using a method reference: w -> l.contains(w)

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.033
frontText: Does this code compile? List byInterface = new ArrayList();
backText: No. Upper bounds use extends for both classes and use interfaces as the upper bound.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.034
frontText: Rewrite this code using a method reference: () -> new ArrayList()

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.035
frontText: What is the natural sort ordering of 123, abc, and ABC?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.036
frontText: Which of these can exist multiple times in a stream pipeline: source, intermediate operation, terminal operation?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.037
frontText: Which functional interface takes two parameters and returns a boolean?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.038
frontText: Which of these are evaluated immediately after the method rather than participating in deferred execution: source, intermediate operation, terminal operation?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.039
frontText: Name a terminal operation that can always terminates on an infinite stream.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.040
frontText: Which functional interface takes zero parameters and has a get() method?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.041
frontText: Which Collector creates a Map with the keys true and false?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.042
frontText: Which intermediate operation returns one element for every element passed into it using a Function to transform?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.043
frontText: Which intermediate operation is used for debugging a finite stream?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.044
frontText: How do you create an Optional without a value?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.045
frontText: Which two static methods create an infinite stream of int primitives?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.046
frontText: How do you check whether an Optional variable named o contains a value and returns a boolean result?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.047
frontText: What does the method getProperty("apple","orange") applied to a java.util.Properties object return on a newly created Properties instance?
backText: orange. Since the Properties instance is nearly created, it would not contain any values, so the default value would be returned.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.048
frontText: True or false? It is a good idea to catch Throwable in your code.
backText: False. Since Error is a subtype of Throwable and Error should never be caught, it is not a good idea to catch Throwable.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.049
frontText: What is printed if you fail to catch an unchecked exception?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.050
frontText: What is the purpose of using a try‐with‐resources statement?
backText: It ensures resources like files and database connections are properly closed at the conclusion of the try section.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.051
frontText: True or false? If a try‐with‐resources block causes multiple exceptions to be thrown at the same time, the first exception encountered becomes the primary, and the rest become suppressed exceptions.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.052
frontText: Why is considered a bad practice for an assertion statement to modify a variable?
backText: Assertions may be disabled at runtime, so writing assertion statements that alter outcomes will produce inconsistent results.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.053
frontText: Which java.time class would it be best to use to share that the meeting is at 2 p.m. in New York City time on Friday?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.054
frontText: When working with a number formatter, which symbol displays a zero if the digit does not exist?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.055
frontText: Name three ways to obtain a locale object.
backText: Call a Locale constructor, use the Locale.Builder class, or use a built‐in constant (such as Locale.CHINA)

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.056
frontText: Which class is used to read text properties based on a particular locale?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.057
frontText: When working with the MessageFormat class, what is the syntax for parameterized values in text strings?
backText: A number, surrounded by braces {}, indicating the numeric order the parameter is provided

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.058
frontText: Under what conditions may a resource created before a try‐with‐resources statement be used in a try‐with‐resources declaration?
backText: The resource must be marked final or effectively final.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.059
frontText: In a service, what is the name of the artifact that implements an interface?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.060
frontText: What type of module is on the classpath?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.061
frontText: When do you need to call the get() method on Provider when working with a service?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.062
frontText: When do you need to specify the uses directive?
backText: In a module that uses a service loader

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.063
frontText: What option do you pass to jdeps to include information about unsupported modules?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.064
frontText: Does the uses directive specify a module, package, interface, or class?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.065
frontText: What is the syntax for a provides directive with service provider interface santa.factory and service provider santa.elves?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.066
frontText: In a bottom‐up migration of three modules, how many modules are on the module path after migrating the first module?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.067
frontText: What property do you specify in the manifest of an automatic module to provide the name that will be used after conversion to a named module?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.068
frontText: In a bottom‐up migration, what two module types are involved?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.069
frontText: True or false? If an automatic module name is not specified, Java keeps dots in the generated name.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.070
frontText: What method is used to retrieve a parallel stream from a Collection object?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.071
frontText: What method in CyclicBarrier causes a thread to wait for the barrier to be reached?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.072
frontText: What is the name for an undesirable result when two tasks that should be completed sequentially are completed at the same time?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.073
frontText: What are the similarities and differences between the ExecutorService methods shutdown() and shutdownNow()?
backText: Both shutdown() and shutdownNow() will cause an ExecutorService to stop accepting new tasks. Unlike the shutdown() method, the shutdownNow() will attempt to stop all previously submitted tasks.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.074
frontText: Which ScheduledExecutorService method allows a task to be completed at a set interval between executions?
backText: scheduleWithFixedDelay(Runnable command, long initialDelay, long period, TimeUnit unit)

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.075
frontText: What are the similarities and differences between Runnable and Callable?
backText: Both Runnable and Callable do not take any arguments. Runnable does not return a value, while Callable returns a generic value.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.076
frontText: Which Lock method will wait indefinitely for a lock if it cannot be acquired?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.077
frontText: What object does a static synchronized method synchronize on?
backText: The static class object. For example, given a class named Wolf, a static synchronized method would synchronize on Wolf.class.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.078
frontText: Which Collections method provides a thread‐safe version of an existing Map?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.079
frontText: What is a ConcurrentSkipListMap?
backText: A ConcurrentSkipListMap is a thread‐safe Map that maintains a natural ordering of its keys.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.080
frontText: What properties of a Collector and stream must be true for a parallel reduction to be performed?
backText: The Collector must have the property of Characteristics.CONCURRENT. If the stream is ordered, then the Collector must also have the property of Characteristics.UNORDERED. Finally, the stream must be parallel.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.081
frontText: True or false? The findAny() method will return the first value in a serial stream and any value in a parallel stream.
backText: False. The behavior of findAny() on a serial stream is not guaranteed. It can return any element on either a serial or parallel stream.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.082
frontText: Define serialization and deserialization.
backText: Serialization is the process of converting an in‐memory object to a byte stream, while deserialization is the reciprocal process.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.083
frontText: Which I/O stream class is best suited for writing binary data to a file?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.084
frontText: True or false? The java.io.Directory class is to used to read directories.
backText: False. The java.io.File class is used for both files and directories.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.085
frontText: What is the difference between an InputStream and a Reader?
backText: An InputStream is used for reading binary data using bytes, while a Reader is used for reading character or text data.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.086
frontText: Which method forces an output stream to empty any temporary or buffered data?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.087
frontText: What is the test for whether a class is considered serializable?
backText: The class must implement java.io.Serializable and contain instance members that either are marked transient or are serializable.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.088
frontText: Besides performance, what is one advantage of using BufferedReader and BufferedWriter when working with a character stream?
backText: They add support for line breaks via readLine() and newLine().

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.089
frontText: When calling PrintWriter format() method, what is the meaning of the symbols %05.2f?
backText: It will display a floating‐point number as five digits, with leading 0s, rounding to two digits after the decimal.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.090
frontText: True or false? A java.io.Console instance can be retrieved using new Console().
backText: False. The factory method System.console() should be used since the Console constructor is private.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.091
frontText: When reading objects from ObjectInputStream, what is the proper way to detect the end of the stream?
backText: Wait for an EOFException to be thrown.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.092
frontText: When deserializing an instance member that was marked transient, what will it be set to?
backText: The default Java type will be used, such as 0 for int, 0.0 for double, or null for String or Object.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.093
frontText: Given a Path instance p, how do you read the third component of the path?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.094
frontText: Which NIO.2 method tests if two Path objects represent the same object within the file system?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.095
frontText: Define a cycle within a file system.
backText: A cycle is a circular dependency in which an entry in a directory tree points to one of its ancestor directories.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.096
frontText: What is advantage of using Files.lines() over Files.readAllLines()?
backText: Files.lines() reads the results via lazy evaluation as a stream.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.097
frontText: Which option should you use when calling Files.copy() if you want to overwrite the target file if it already exists?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.098
frontText: What is the name of the method that creates Path objects in the Paths class?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.099
frontText: What does the Path relativize() method do?
backText: It constructs a relative path from one Path to another. It will throw an exception if one is absolute and the other is relative.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.100
frontText: What is the result of calling Paths.get("/sing/../song.txt/./piano").normalize()?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.101
frontText: True or false? Files.list() reads a single directory.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.102
frontText: Given a Path instance p, how do you find out the directory that contains p?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.103
frontText: True or false? The NIO.2 Files class includes a method, newBufferedInputStream() that reads the contents of a file into an I/O stream.
backText: False. It does contain a newBufferedReader() method, though.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.104
frontText: What NIO.2 Files methods allow you to both read and write file attributes?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.105
frontText: On a ResultSet, what method moves the cursor to the first row?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.106
frontText: What are the main parts of a JDBC URL?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.107
frontText: True or false? Calling rs.getString(1) before calling rs.next() throws a SQLException on a ResultSet.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.108
frontText: In what order should a Connection, PreparedStatement, and ResultSet be closed?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.109
frontText: When closing a ResultSet, what other resources get closed?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.110
frontText: What methods on PreparedStatement can run a SELECT SQL statement?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.111
frontText: When closing a Connection, what other resources get closed?
backText: ResultSet and Statement (including PreparedStatement and CallableStatement), if they are associated with the connection

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.112
frontText: What symbol is used to represent a bind variable in a PreparedStatement?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.113
frontText: What does executeQuery() return?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.114
frontText: What parameter type can fill in the blank for a CallableStatement for the following? cs.setInt(_____, 1);

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.115
frontText: What are three types of CallableStatement parameters?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.116
frontText: What does execute() return?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.117
frontText: True or false? All HashMap instances with 1,000 key/value pairs have the same performance.
backText: False. It depends on whether the keys have many duplicate hashes.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.118
frontText: True or false? Making a class final makes all the methods final.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.119
frontText: What is the name of the technique for applying multiple preventative techniques to the same problem?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.120
frontText: True or false? A security policy grants permissions.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.121
frontText: A list of characters that aren’t allowed in a string is a ______________.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.122
frontText: True or false? All methods in Java can be cloned successfully.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.123
frontText: True or false? Using a PreparedStatement prevents SQL injection.
backText: False. Bind variables must be used for all user‐supplied data.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.124
frontText: Forgetting to close a file is a _____________________.

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.125
frontText: What method often contains a reference to ObjectInputStream.GetField?

title: fc617624.JaSE11PrgIISG.f2.126
frontText: Which two methods used in serialization and deserialization return an object instead of void?
